message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.SD 

This paper is about evaluating language models, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP). The most relevant sub-category for this paper is likely "cs.CL" (Computation and Language), which focuses on the intersection of computer science and linguistics. "cs.LG" (Machine Learning) is also a likely sub-category, as the paper proposes a new evaluation metric that is based on entropy and discriminative training. "cs.AI" (Artificial Intelligence) is another possible sub-category, as language modeling is a fundamental task in AI. "cs.NE" (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) is also a possible sub-category, as the paper proposes a new sentence-level interpretation of recurrent neural network-based language models. Finally, "cs.SD" (Sound) is a less likely sub-category, as it is not directly related to the content of the paper.
